translated: While the five musical instruments are sounding, along with the benedictions of the Brahmins, the preceptor

It fulfills all wishes and removes all faults in mantras.

It pacifies possession by spirits and removes the fear of Dākinīs.

analyzed: para droha parāḥ ye ca te narāḥ kali kiṅkarāḥ
translated: and those who are devoted to harming others, they are the servants of Kali.

analyzed: kula dharmeṣu abhaktāḥ ye kāmukāḥ
translated: Those who are not devoted to the Dharma of the Kula, who are lustful towards others,

analyzed: dveṣṭāraḥ kula niṣṭhānām te jñeyāḥ kali kiṅkarāḥ
translated: and who hate those who are devoted to the Kula, they should be known as the servants of Kali.

original: prakaṭe'tra kalau devi / sarve dharmāśca durbalāḥ /
analyzed: prakaṭe tra kalau devi sarve dharmāḥ ca durbalāḥ
translated: O Goddess, in this Kali Yuga, all Dharmas are weak.

analyzed: sthāsyati ekam satya mātram tasmāt satya mayaḥ bhavet
translated: Only truth will remain, therefore one should be full of truth.

analyzed: satya dharmam samāśritya yat karmma kurute naraḥ
translated: Whatever action a man performs relying on the Dharma of truth,

original: tadeva saphalaṃ karmma satyaṃ jānīhi suvrate / /
analyzed: tat eva saphalam karmma satyam jānīhi suvrate
translated: That alone is fruitful action. Know truth, O you of good vows.

original: na hi satyāt paro dharmo na pāpamanṛtātparam /
analyzed: na hi satyāt paraḥ dharmaḥ na pāpam anṛtāt param
translated: There is no Dharma higher than truth, and no sin greater than falsehood.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva ātmanā martyaḥ satyam ekam samāśrayet
translated: Therefore, a mortal should rely solely on truth with his whole being.

original: satyahīnā vṛthā pūjā satyahīno vṛthā japaḥ /
analyzed: satya hīnā vṛthā pūjā satya hīnaḥ vṛthā japaḥ
translated: Worship without truth is futile, Japa without truth is futile.

original: satyamūlāḥ kriyāḥ sarvāḥ satyāt parataraṃ na hi /🔽ataeva mayā proktaṃ duṣkṛte prabale kalau /
analyzed: satya mūlāḥ kriyāḥ sarvāḥ satyāt parataram na hi  ataeva mayā proktam duṣkṛte prabale kalau
translated: All actions have truth as their root. There is nothing higher than truth.

analyzed: kula ācāraḥ api satyena karttavyaḥ vyakta bhāvataḥ
translated: For this very reason, it is said by me that in the powerful Kali Yuga, even the conduct of the Kula should be performed with truth, with manifest devotion.

analyzed: gopanāt hīyate satyam na guptiḥ anṛtam vinā
translated: Truth is lost due to concealment, and there is no concealment without falsehood.

original: tasmāt prakāśataḥ kuryyāt kaulikaḥ kulasādhanam /🔽kuladharmmasya guptyarthaṃ nānṛtyaṃ syājjugupsitam /
analyzed: tasmāt prakāśataḥ kuryyāt kaulikaḥ kula sādhanam  kula dharmmasya gupti artham na anṛtyam syāt jugupsitam
translated: Therefore, a Kaulika should perform the means of Kula openly.🔽For the sake of the secrecy of the Dharma of Kula, there should be no despised falsehood.

original: yaduktaṃ kulatantreṣu na śastaṃ prabale kalau /
analyzed: yat uktam kula tantreṣu na śastam prabale kalau
translated: What is said in the Kula Tantras is not recommended in the powerful Kali Yuga.

analyzed: kṛte dharmaḥ catuṣpādaḥ tretāyām pāda hīnakaḥ
translated: In Kṛta age, Dharma had four feet. In Tretā age, it had one foot less.

original: dviṃpādo dvāpare devi / pādamātraṃ kalau yuge /
analyzed: dviṃpādaḥ dvāpare devi pāda mātram kalau yuge
translated: In Dvāpara age, O Goddess, it had two feet, and in Kali age, it has only one foot.

original: tarāpi satyaṃ balavattapaḥ khaṇḍaṃ dayāpi ca /
analyzed: tarā api satyam balavat tapaḥ khaṇḍam dayā api ca
translated: Even that truth, strength, penance, and compassion are weakened.

analyzed: satya pāde kṛte lope dharmma lopaḥ prajāyate
translated: If the foot of truth is removed in Kṛta age, Dharma is lost.

original: p / tasmāt satyaṃ samāśritya sarvakarmāṇi sādhayet /
analyzed: tasmāt satyam samāśritya sarva karmāṇi sādhayet
translated: Therefore, one should accomplish all actions by resorting to truth.

analyzed: kula ācāram vinā yatra nā asti upāyaḥ kuleśvari
translated: O Goddess of Kula, where there is no means without the conduct of the Kula,

original: tatrānṛtapraveśaḥ syāt kuto niḥśreyasaṃ bhavet /🔽sarvathā satyapūtātmā manmukheritavartmanā /
analyzed: tatra anṛta praveśaḥ syāt kutas niḥśreyasam bhavet  sarvathā satya pūta ātmā mad mukha īrita vartmanā
translated: there should be the entry of untruth. How can there be liberation?

analyzed: sarvam karma naraḥ kuryyāt sva sva varṇa āśrama uditam
translated: In every way, a man should perform all actions prescribed for his own caste and stage of life, with a soul purified by truth, following the path proclaimed by me.

analyzed: dīkṣām pūjām japam homam puraścaraṇa tarpaṇam
translated: Initiation, worship, japa, homa, expiation, tarpaṇa,

analyzed: vrata uddvāhau puṃsavanam sīmantonnayanam tathā
translated: Vrata, Uddvāha (marriage), Puṃsavana, Sīmanta, Unnayana,

original: jātakarma tathā nāma cūḍākaraṇameva ca /🔽yātrāṃ gṛhapraveśañca navavastrādidhāraṇam /
analyzed: jātakarma tathā nāma cūḍākaraṇam eva ca  yātrām gṛha praveśam ca nava vastra ādi dhāraṇam
translated: Jātakarma, Namakarman, and Cūḍākarman,🔽Journey, entering the house, wearing new clothes, etc.,

analyzed: vāpa ukūpa taḍāgānām saṃskāram tithi karma ca
translated: Purification of wells, tanks, and lakes, and rites on auspicious days,

analyzed: gṛha ārambham pratiṣṭhām ca devatā sthāpanam tathā
translated: Beginning of house construction, installation, and establishment of deities,

analyzed: mayā uktena vidhānena tat sarvam sādhayet naraḥ
translated: A man can accomplish all that by the method stated by me.

analyzed: yadi mad matam utsṛjya maheśi prabale kalau
translated: If, O Maheshi, one abandons my opinion and acts strongly in Kali Yuga,

original: tadā yat kriyate karma viparītāya tadbhavet //
analyzed: tadā yat kriyate karma viparītāya tat bhavet
translated: then the karma performed will lead to the opposite.

analyzed: aṣṭama ullāse
translated: In the eighth Ullasam.

original: ato'tra kathitaṃ devi / dvijānāṃ prabale kalī //
analyzed: atas utra kathitam devi dvijānām prabale kalī
translated: Therefore, O Goddess, it is said here that for the twice-born, in the strong Kali Yuga,

analyzed: gāyatryām adhikāraḥ usti na anya mantreṣu karhicit
translated: there is authority in the Gayatri, never in other mantras.

analyzed: dvijātīnām prabheda artham śūrebhyaḥ parameśvari
translated: For the classification of the twice-born, O Supreme Goddess,

analyzed: sandhyā iyam vaidikī proktā prāk evā āhnika karmaṇaḥ
translated: this is said to be the Vedic Sandhya, before the daily rituals.🔽Vishvasa Ramaharya-named, here of meritorious fame, the best,

original: viśvāso rāmaharyyāhvaya iha sakṛtī puṇyakīrttirvariṣṭhaḥ sākṣāddharmo mahātmā sma
analyzed: viśvāsaḥ rāmaharyyā āhvayaḥ iha sakṛtī puṇya kīrttiḥ variṣṭhaḥ sākṣāt dharmaḥ mahātmā sma
translated: directly Dharma, the magnanimous one,

analyzed: janayati naraḥ śrīla nārāyaṇa bhau
translated: generates in men the devotion to the illustrious Lord Narayana.

analyzed: śāntau dāntau sat antaḥkṛti milita jagat mohana prāṇa kṛṣṇau śrī vāṇīśau
translated: In peace, in self-control, always self-controlled, the two who unite the world and enchant the life-force of Krishna, the two Shri and Vani,

analyzed: pratāpa anala kalita mahā arāti vaṃśa aṭavīkau
translated: the two who burn the forest of the great enemy's lineage with the fire of their valor,

analyzed: śrī prāṇa kṛṣṇa viśvāsaḥ sutān sapta mahā udayān
translated: Shri Pranakrishna Vishvasa begot seven sons of great prosperity,

analyzed: ajījanat deva vipra bhaktān nānā guṇa anvitān
translated: devotees of gods and Brahmins, endowed with various qualities.
Shri LAnanda-maya, the eldest, always full of bliss, the successful one,

analyzed: śrī rāmacandraḥ tadanu dayā dharma pratāpavān
translated: Then Sri Ramachandra, full of compassion, righteousness and glory,

analyzed: śrī viśvanāthaḥ viśvātmā tadanu jñāna dānavān
translated: Then Sri Vishvanatha, the soul of the universe, the giver of knowledge,

analyzed: śrī śambhunāthaḥ tadanu snigdha mūrtiḥ dayā mayaḥ
translated: Then Sri Shambhunatha, the compassionate one with a loving form,
The lord of Kashi, the trust of the universe, the purifier of the family of trust,

analyzed: śrī candranāthaḥ tadanu candra dṛkṣaḥ guṇa ākāraḥ
translated: Then Sri Chandranatha, the moon-like one, the embodiment of virtues,

analyzed: ete api uda yoginaḥ grantha kāraṇāyai yatas sadā
translated: These too are always engaged in the composition of this treatise.

analyzed: atas nāmāni atra teṣām nibadhnāmi ati yatnataḥ
translated: Therefore, I carefully record their names here.

original: dhīmān śrīmān bhuvanaviditastantrasārasya karttā kṛṣṇānando'jani bhuvi
analyzed: dhīmān śrīmān bhuvana viditaḥ tantra sārasya karttā kṛṣṇānanda ujani bhuvi
translated: The wise and prosperous Krishnaananda, the author of Tantrasara, was born on this earth,
The lamp of the land of the nine islands.

original: kāśīnātho'bhavadiha sutastasya sārāvalīkṛt vidvān mānyo'jani tadanujo
analyzed: kāśīnāthaḥ bhavat iha sutaḥ tasya sāra āvalī kṛt vidvān
translated: His son, the lord of Kashi, the author of Saraavali, was born here, the wise and venerable one,
Known as Vishvanatha.

original: p / gopālo nirṇayakṛtiyaśasvī madhoḥ sūdanāccābhūtāṃ putrau madhusuta itaḥ
analyzed: gopālaḥ nirṇaya kṛti yaśasvī madhoḥ sūdanāt ca abhūtām putrau madhu sutaḥ itas

analyzed: kālidāsaḥ prasiddhaḥ

analyzed: tad putraḥ bhūt raghu vara paraḥ nāthaḥ ekānta buddhiḥ tad sūnuḥ ca abhavat iha sudhī maṅgalaḥ
translated: His son was Raghuvardhana, devoted to Lord Vishnu, and his son was the wise Angamangala,

analyzed: kṛṣṇa pūrvaḥ
translated: Preceded by Krishna.

analyzed: śrī kṛṣṇamaṅgala sutaḥ navavallikāyāḥ śrī rāmatoṣaṇaḥ idam kṛtavān dvitīyam

analyzed: kāṇḍam tu saṃskṛti yutam phala puṣpa śobham dharma abhidham kṛtimatām sakala iṣṭa siddhyai
